nodes.description: 2012年7月22日，Breivik在奥斯陆政府区实施爆炸并开枪扫射，造成77人死亡
nodes.support_text: Breivik has admitted killing 77 people and wounding more than 240 others when he bombed central Oslo and then opened fire at a youth camp on Utoeya.

nodes.description: 17:25当地时间，尤特亚岛枪击事件开始，10分钟内警方接到枪击报案
nodes.support_text: As early as 17:25 local time, shootings were reported on Utoeya Within five minutes, police were contacted by a boat captain offering his vessel

nodes.description: 17:55两名当地警察抵达湖岸，因等待精英部队未立即采取行动
nodes.support_text: The first local police patrol arrived at 17:55, but the two officers did not try to find a boat despite guidelines recommending an immediate response to gun attacks

nodes.description: 18:27精英部队使用临时船只抵达尤特亚岛，延误35分钟到达核心区域
nodes.support_text: They could have reached the island at 18:15, the commission suggests Most of the dead were young activists who were taking part in a summer camp on Utoeya

nodes.description: 8月13日，独立调查报告指出警方存在严重反应迟缓问题
nodes.support_text: Among the most damaging of the report's conclusions is that a two-man local police team reached the lake shore at Utvika first, but chose to wait for better-trained colleagues rather than find a boat and cross to Utoeya themselves

nodes.description: 报告揭示警方未及时跟进10分钟后收到的 Breivik特征描述
nodes.support_text: A pedestrian made a phone-call 10 minutes after the Oslo bomb went off, giving police a good description of a man carrying a pistol and wearing protective clothing. The operator passed the message on but the tip-off was not followed up for some two hours

nodes.description: 8月13日，政府确认未实施全国性紧急警报和交通管制
nodes.support_text: Although it was clear that a terrorist attack had been carried out, the inquiry says no immediate nationwide alert was given, no roadblocks or observation posts were set up
A verdict in Breivik's trial is due on 24 August

nodes.description: 调查报告建议加强安保措施以预防类似袭击
nodes.support_text: More security and emergency measures to prevent further attacks and 'mitigate adverse effects' should have been implemented on 22 July

nodes.description: 政府总理Stoltenberg公开承认警方失误但未要求辞职
nodes.support_text: Jens Stoltenberg said he deeply regretted the mistakes that had been made and took responsibility for what had happened but stopped short of saying there would be ministerial resignations
officers did not try to find a boat despite guidelines recommending an immediate response to gun attacks
Delta team was forced to abandon dinghy
Most of the dead were young activists
activists taking part in a summer camp
